content.title: Error: EBUSY: resource busy or locked, copyfile 'C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Roaming\youtube\bun-temp\bun-windows-x64\bun.exe' -> 'C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Roaming\youtube\bun.exe'
content.body:
View details in Rollbar: [https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/28](https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/28)

```

Error: EBUSY: resource busy or locked, copyfile 'C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Roaming\youtube\bun-temp\bun-windows-x64\bun.exe' -> 'C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Roaming\youtube\bun.exe'
  File "node:fs", line 3034, in Object.copyFileSync
  File "node:electron/js2c/node_init", line 2, in Object.func [as copyFileSync]
  File "C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Local\Programs\youtube\resources\app.asar\src\index.js", line 334, in build
  File "node:internal/process/task_queues", line 95, in process.processTicksAndRejections
```
content.author: alphaleadership

acceptanceCriteria: The 'youtube' application successfully completes the 'bun.exe' copy operation without encountering an 'EBUSY' error under normal operating conditions.
The 'youtube' application provides clear user feedback or implements a robust retry mechanism if the target file is temporarily locked during the copy process.
The update/installation process for 'bun.exe' in the 'youtube' application ensures that no conflicting processes hold a lock on the target file prior to or during the copy operation.

details: The provided GitHub issue describes an error occurring in a 'youtube' Electron application (indicated by paths like 'C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Roaming\youtube\' and 'app.asar'), which does not appear to belong to the 'github-gemini-integration' project based on the provided project structure. This makes direct file modifications within the current project context inappropriate for resolving this specific bug.
Detailed steps to reproduce the 'EBUSY' error are missing (e.g., exact user actions, specific timing, system environment details beyond OS type).
Information on what specific action or event within the 'youtube' application triggers the 'bun.exe' copy operation (e.g., application update, first launch, specific feature usage) is missing.
